TopicTitle: Maneuver node backup (save a "good enough" node while you try for a "perfect" one)

Articles.Content:
I'd like a mod that will back up a maneuver node, and restore it on demand.

Many times when I'm setting up a node, I'll end up with a "good enough" result. It gets me what I need, but I'd like to shave off some dV or fine-tune it so my rendezvous is perfect. And many times those tweaks actually make it worse, but now I've lost the node that worked.

It'd be great if I could back up that "good enough" node so that I can reset it if my tweaks are counter-productive.

In a perfect world, this would be integrated into [Precise Node](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/47863-1-0-2-Precise-Node-1-1-3-Precisely-edit-your-maneuver-nodes).
Kerbal alarm Clock can do that. just set an alarm for the node you want to keep. later you can edit that alarm and restore the node
Get precisenode, and you can either remember the values or fine tune your node without fear of destroying the node with the crappy stock node gimbal. That thing is seriously impractical.
Good enough F5. Stuffed your fine tuning F9. No mod necessary.
